questline.step: First encounter at in Stormhill, Limgrave
questline.description: The first time the player can encounter D is east of Stormhill Shack in Limgrave. You can also find him in Roundtable Hold.

After defeating the Tibia Mariner in Summonwater Village, return to D at the Roundtable Hold or rest at site of grace and find him by the southwestern entrance in the water of Summonwater Village. He will give you directions to Bestial Sanctum in Caelid, however you can get there by going to the 'Sending Gate' in East Limgrave. After talking with Gurranq and selecting 'yes' while talking to D, he will become a merchant and sell you incantations.
During Rogier's questline, a letter left to you by Rogier mentions that D has a younger brother, and hints at his location.

During Fia's and Rogier's questline, you will be asked to find the owner of a particular Weathered Dagger. D is the owner. Give him the dagger and reload the area. Then, in a newly opened room in the back of the Roundtable Hold, you will find D's Bell Bearing and the Twinned Set.

You can find D's twin brother, 'D, Beholder of Death' in Nokron. Upon interacting with him, you will receive the Inner Order gesture. Unaltered D's armor can be given to his brother, and after reloading the area you will be able to summon him for the fight with Valiant Gargoyles. You can also kill D, Hunter of the Dead at his first location and then give his armor to his brother, but this will cause the brother to be aggressive and fight you.
The first time the player can encounter Diallos is at Roundtable Hold. You need to exhaust his dialogue.

After talking with him at the Roundtable Hold, he will move to Liurnia and can be found atop a sunken roof West of the Academy Gate Town Site of Grace. IMPORTANT: completing the Volcano Manor legacy dungeon before this step prevents him from spawning there.
Exhaust his dialogue at the Roundtable Hold.

You will find him in the drawing room at the Volcano Manor. For each step of the Volcano Manor assassination sidequests, he gets new dialogue. After accepting the second letter from VOlcano Manor, he will relocate to Jarburg.

After progressing Jar-Bairn's questline, Diallos will appear in a shack tending to Jar-Bairn. You need to repeatedly talk to Jar-Bairn and rest at the Site of Grace in Jarburg until Jar-Bairn talks about poachers.  If you've gotten this questline to advance, Jar-Bairn will talk about a new Potentiate who's just arrived. Then, you need to let some time pass. Once enough time has passed, you need to exhaust Diallos' and Jar-Bairn's dialogue.

After defeating Radahn, exhaust Alexander's dialogue. He will be gathering corpses at the arena nearby the site of grace. Then, return to Jarburg. Find wounded Diallos and exhaust his and Jar-Bairn's dialogue. The choice of dialogue with Diallos does not matter. After reloading the area, you can find Jar-Bairn near Diallos. Exhaust his dialogue and reload the area. In the place of Diallos's body you will find Diallos's Mask.

Complete Alexander's questline and return to Jarburg. Give Jar-Bairn Alexander's Innards and reload the area. In place of Jar-Bairn you will find Companion Jar Talisman. You can also find Hoslow's Petal Whip and Numen's Rune in the middle of the town.
The first time the player can encounter Brother Corhyn is at Roundtable Hold.
As soon as you reach Atlus Plateau, when speaking to Brother Corhyn, he will tell you he is heading onto a journey trying to find the Goldmask. He moves to Atlus Plateau after resting.

After talking with Brother Corhyn nearby the Atlus Highway Junction site of Grace, you have to find Goldmask. He is standing on the north section of the Forest-Spanning Great Bridge, south of East Windmill Pasture. After you interact with Goldmask, you can go back to Corhyn and tell him Goldmask's whereabouts. After resting, he will move to where you found Goldmask.

In order to progress this questline, you need to obtain at least two Great Runes and have access to Leyndell. Both Goldmask and Corhyn will move to Leyndell, and can be found on a cliff up west of the colosseum. You need to exhaust Corhyn's dialogue. IMPORTANT: You need to solve this riddle before burning the Erdtree at Forge of the Giants - otherwise, Corhyn will vanish and leave behind his bell bearing, and Goldmask will not be present. The solution is as follows: First, you need to travel west of the Erdtree Sanctuary site of grace, down an elevator and a set of stairs. A white message on the ground facing the statue mentions 'Regression'. You must stand on the message, facing the statue, and cast the Law of Regression incantation to solve the riddle. Touch the new message that appears, and report the secret to Goldmask and then exhaust Corhyn's dialogue.

After leaving Goldmask and Brother Corhyn (reloading the area will not work), they will move to the bridge south of Stargazer's Ruins right above the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins site of grace. You might give Corhyn Tonic of Forgetfulness, but he will refuse the potion. It will change the final outcome of the questline.

After completing Farum Azula (defeating Maliketh), you can find Goldmask in Leyndell, Ashen Capital. He moves to the bottom of the colosseum cliffs facing the west side of the Erdtree Sanctuary site of grace. He will give you the Mending Rune of Perfect Order. Reload the area to loot Goldmask's Set.

Corhyn can be found in on of the possible two locations: First location - he should be at the base of the giant spiral spear. After you exhaust his dialogue and reload the area, you can find a Flail, Corhyn's Bell Bearing and his robe where he was sitting. Second possible location: if you offered him the Tonic of Forgetfulness, he will remain at the bridge south of the Stargazers' Ruins where you last saw him. Talk to him; he'll be unaware of Goldmask's absence. Reload the area and then collect all three of the above items where he was. If you don't complete the questline, you can find his bell bearing and robe ona cliff west of the colosseum in the Ashen Capital.
Fia can be found at the Roundtable Hold, sitting on a bed. Allowing her to hold you rewards you with Baldachin's Blessing, which decreases your max HP by 5%, up until you consume it.

After resting at a site of grace in Atlus Plateau, when you go back to Fia at the Roundtable Hold you will be able to be held by her for a second time, after which she will give you a Weathered Dagger. After receiving the dagger, go talk to D, Hunter of the Dead at the Roundtable Hold and give it to him.

Speak with Rogier about the black knives. After you also speak to Fia, she will give you Knifeprint Clue, revealing location of a Black Knifeprint. After you reload the area you'll find Fia in a newly opened room near Hewg, and after this encounter she will disappear.

In Deeproot Depths, head to the Across the Roots site of grace and enter the boss arena to the north. There, you will fight Fia's Champions. Upon talking to her, tell her that you want to be hugged. She then will ask you to bring her the Cursemark of Death, which is found duriing Ranni's quest. If Fia is not there, and she has already killed D, you might have to follow a few extra steps. First, kill the Valiant Gargoyles and rest in the coffin in the arena. This will take you to Deeproot Depths, after which Fia might appear. Another possible route is by revealing 2 illusory walls after the encounter with the Three Fingers.
After you give the Cursemark of Death to Fia, she will give you Radiant Baldachin's Blessing. Exhaust her dialogue and reload the area. Interact with sleeping Fia and fight Lichdragon Fortissax.

questline.step: First and second encounter at the Roundtable Hold
questline.description: You can find him at the Roundtable Hold the first time you get there. Once you leave the Hold and return once more, he will have relocated to his room guarded by Ensha. Gideon will instruct you to kill Godrick the Grafted.
After defeating Godrick you'll have to speak to Enia at the Roundtable Hold in order for Gideon to reopen doors to his room.

After defating a second Shardbearer, come back to Gideon. You'll be able to talk with him about Nepheli Loux. Around this time, while progressing Preceptor Seluvis' questline, you might give Seluvis' Potion to Gideon. This simply prevents you from giving the potion to other NPCs, which would end up ending that NPC's questline.

After defeating Morgott, return to Gideon. He will disclose locations of other Shardbearers and provide you with rewards after killing each one: reaching Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum - [Fevor's Cookbook[3]], Defeating Mohg, Lord of Blood - [Law of Causality], reaching Miquella's Haligtree - [Black Flame's Protection], defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella - [Lord's Divine Fortification]

questline.step: Final encounter at the Ashen capital
questline.description: After defeating Maliketh and returning to Leyndell, head towards the Erdtree Sanctuary. There, you will find Gideon monologuing and attacking you. After the fight, you will obtain his armor set as well as his scepter, ending his questline.
During Ranni's questline, if you give Ranni the Fingerslayer Blade you will not be able to give Dung Eater Seluvis's Potion.
The first time you can meet the Dung Eater is after gaining access to the Atlus Plateau. He can be found in a room past the twin maidens.

After giving him at least one Seedbed Curse, he will give you the Sewer-Gaol Key, used to open his cell in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, which you can access by descending down a well in Leyndell.

He can be found in his cell in the sewers. Tell him he's been freed and return to Roundtable Hold. </br>To find his cell, follow these steps: </br>1. Spawn at the Underground Roadside grace. </br>2. Leave the room and take a left. </br>3. Head down the corridor and jump down the open gate. </br>4. Run northwest and go past the giant poison plants and climb the ladder. </br>5. Past the giant hand is the Sewer Gaol room with Dung Eater inside.

After returning to Roundtable Hold, you will not find Dung Eater, but his message for you to fight him at the 'outer moat'. If you're progressing Blackguard Big Boggart's questline, make sure to complete it before doing this step, or else he will not drop a Seedbed Curse.

questline.step: Another encounter at the Roundtable Hold
questline.description: Upon defeat, he will return to the Roundtable Hold. From now on, you can give him Seluvis's Potion to end Dung Eater's questline, or Seedbed Curses to progress it.

After giving him 5th and final Seedbed Curse, his questline will be complete and you will be rewarded with the Mending Rune of the Fell Curse. You can also reload the area to find the Omen Set in his place.

rewards: Warrior Jar Shard (if you kill him before Farum Azula)

questline.description: If you kill him before Crumbling Farum Azula, he will not drop Shard of Alexander and Alexander's Innards - instead, he will drop the Warrior Jar Shard.

Help Alexander get out of a hole by hitting him a few times. Don't be scared to attack him, he will tell you to keep trying. He will reward you with Triumphant Delight Gesture and a piece of Exalted Flesh. He also will tell you where he's headed.
You can skip this step by already starting the Radahn Festival. The second time you can find Alexander is in Gael Tunnel. He will once again mention the festival in Redmane Castle.

You can find Alexander in Redmane Castle along other participants. You can summon him for the fight against Radahn. After defeating Radahn, you can find Alexander nearby the site of grace in Wailing Dunes and talk to him.

His next location is in Liurnia, nearby the Carian Study Hall, stuck in a hole once again. This time, just attacking him will not result in success. You need to thorw an Oil Pot to make him slippery, and then get him out. He will thank you and reward you with an Exalted Flesh, saying that he's headed North to become an even stronger warrior.

This time, you will find Alexander in a lava lake just behind a Magma Wyrm. You will be able to safely talk to him once you walk on one of the stones in the lava pool. There, he will award you with the Jar and head to the forge of the giants. You will be able to summon him for the fight against the Fire Giant, just outisde of the arena.
The last time you meet Alexander is in Crumbling Farum Azula. Here, he will request one final duel. Once you defeat him, he will reward you with Alexander's Innards and the Shard of Alexander.

In Mistwood, you can hear a wolf's howl. You can ask Merchant Kale about the howling, and the merchant will teach you the Finger Snap Gesture. Then, you can meet Blaidd on the tallest point in Mistwood Ruins. Once you use the Finger Snap Gesture below him, he will jump down. He will tell you he's hunting for a man called 'Darriwil'.

In the Forlorn Hound Evergaol, you can fight Darriwil. Blaidd will be available as a summon, and you'll be able to talk to him after the fight had concluded. Exhaust his dialogue to get a Somber Smithing Stone [2] and he'll mention Iji. Doing this will unluck the Carian Filigreed Crest in the blacksmith's shop. If you've completed the Evergaol fight before meeting Blaidd, he will be standing there available to speak to.

During Ranni's questline, you will be tasked with talking to Blaidd in Siofra River, who will then tell you to talk to Preceptor Seluvis, directing you to Sorceress Sellen. After talking to Sellen, he will request you find him at Redmane Castle.
You can skip to this step by using the Grand Lift of Dectus. Blaidd, among other warriors can be found in the courtyard of Redmane Castle. He will aid oyu in the fight against Radahn.
This step is optional: after defeating Radahn, you can find BLaidd trapped inside the Forlorn Hound Evergaol. You can also talk with Iji about that for some additional dialogue.

After you complete Ranni's questline, return to Ranni's Rise to find hostile Blaidd. Defeat him to get his greatsword and his set, except for the helm, which can be found near Seluvis's Rise. This concludes Blaidd's questline.

Melina is directly connected to the main quest. This page is more of a list of interactions with her throughout the main quest.

After resting at a site of grace oustide of the Church of Elleh, Melina will appear and begin a conversation. This interaction will allow you to level up, as well as reward you with the ability to summon Torrent.

At the next site of grace you rest at before entering Stormveil Castle, you will be able to talk to her again. She will tell you about a Shardbearer in the Stormveil Castle, as well as about golden lines guiding you through the game. At the next site of grace, you will be able to talk with her about her puprose.

questline.step: Conversation at the Third Church of Marika
questline.description: At the Third Church of Marika, upon talking with her she will describe echoes of Queen Marika the Eternal.

questline.step: Conversation at the Church of Pilgrimage
questline.description: Upon talking to Melina, she gives you the option to elucidate on the echoes.
You can summon her for the fight against Morgott, just outside the boss arena.
After failing to enter the Erdtree upon Morgott's defeat, rest at the Elden Throne site of Grace. She will then guide you to the Mountaintop of the Giants.
At some sites of grace, Melina will have additional dialogue reminding you of the goal at the Mountaintops.

After defeating the Fire Giant and reaching the Forge of the Giants, talk with Melina at the grace. If you haven't inherited the Frenzied Flame, this will be the last time you see her. If you have, she will later appear after the ending of the game.

Ranni is first encountered going by the name Renna, when the player teleports to the Church of Elleh, after meeting Melina and acquiring Torrent. Upon talking with Renna she gives the player the Spirit Calling Bell and the Lone Wolf Ashes. Not meeting Renna does not prevent the quest from being completed.

The first time the player encounters Ranni the Witch is at the top of Ranni's Rise, which requires Royal Knight Loretta to be defeated at the Caria Manor. If the Radahn Festival is happening, you will have to first defeat Radahn in order to find Ranni at Ranni's Rise.

At the top of Ranni's Rise she tasks the player with finding the hidden treasure of Nokron and asks you to speak with Iji, Blaidd and Preceptor Seluvis, who appear as ghostly projections in the tower. You have to talk with all three of them to leave the tower area. After talking with all three projections, talk to Ranni again and you'll be able to fast travel as normal. If you haven't found Ranni formerly known as Renna, you will have to talk to Rogier at the Roundtable Hold and speak with him to continue Ranni's questline as normal.

questline.step: Encounter with Blaidd in Siofra River
questline.description: Blaidd will be waiting for you in Siofra River. He will instruct you to talk with Seluvis (who can be found in his tower near Ranni's Rise), who then tells you to find Sorceress Sellen.
You'll find Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins. She will tell you that in order to reach Nokron you need to defeat Starscourge Radahn.

Defeating Radahn forces a star to struck Limgrave, south of Mistwood. You can talk to Iji about the fallen star. The impact has created a new entrance into Nokron, through which you'll be able to access the underground area.

Once you reach Nokron Ancestral Woods site of grace, you need to jump across nearby ledge and reach the city. As you continue onward you will eventually find a chest containing the Fingerslayer Blade - the treasure Ranni seeks.
Giving Ranni the Fingerslayer Blade will make Preceptor Seluvis a lifeless puppet, which stops his questline.

Once you return to Ranni and give her the Fingerslayer Blade, she will reward you with the Carian Inverted Statue, which can be used at a pedestal at the entrance to the Carian Study Hall. Upon arriving at the top of the Divine Tower of Liurnia, you will be able to find the Cursemark of Death.

questline.step: Renna's Rise and the miniature Ranni doll
questline.description: Upon giving Ranni the blade, you will gain acess to Renna's Rise. There, you can find the Snow Witch Set as well as a waygate able to transport you to Ainsel River Main, where you can find the miniature Ranni doll. Rest at the Ainsel River Main site of grace and talk to miniature Ranni three times. She will task you wi th defeating a Baleful Shadow found further into the area. Defeating the shadow rewards you with the Discarded Palace Key.

questline.step: Dark Moon Ring and the Naturalborn of the Void
questline.description: Use the Discarded Key to access the chest found in the Raya Lucaria Grand Library next to Rennala, which contains the Dark Moon Ring. Go back to Lake of Rot and reach the Grand Cloister. There, you can interact with a stone coffin and prepare to fight Astel, Naturalborn of the void. Upon it's defeat, with the Ring you'll be able to pass a magic seal, which blocks the path to the Moonlight Altar.

Collect 11 Starlight Shards scattered in the Cathedral of Manus Celes. Then, drop down the hole near the site of grace and continue through the tunnel. Interact with Ranni's doll body and place the Dark Moon Ring on ranni's Finger. She then confirms you as her consort nad drop the Dark Moon Greatsword.
After defeating the Elden Beast, interact with a blue summon sign near Marika's broken remains to acquire the 'Age of Stars' ending.
